message: Killerstartups.com

So, as the title suggests, I asked to be on a conference call that I really didn't need to be on, babysitting some long running tasks.  Taking a break from my regular work, I decided to start a project to see how far I could get.
The result is at http://loudstartup.com/ (I registered the domain and everything within the 2 hours, so DNS might need to propagate for you).

The logic of it was that I was looking for str's "ShoutStart.com" recently, but it seems to have disappeared.  Thinking it was a good source of information, I think it needs to exist in some form, whether or not there's a 'business' associated with it.

So, here's where I need your help.  I only just started -- and while I know of a few other places doing startup coverage (The Startup Foundry, The Next Web, etc.) the list in my head is by no means exhaustive.
Please post any other suggestions here that do any sort of startup coverage.
http://www.quora.com/What-are-some-blogs-a-new-startup-should-send-press-releases-to?
wooga
That is a beautiful answer Chris.  Thanks!
@bmelton Cograts for the tool. It is really useful. There's yet a BM?

@bmelton I have feedback about you project, that I'm using to promote my product. The submission link open a page in the current window. I suggest you to open them in a new windows. More usable.

And when the link is an email it doesn't work. The link open this url "http://loudstartup.com/tips@venturebeat.com". There are a lot of link like this
@ccarnino Thanks for the heads up.  I'll get the email links fixed asap.
@ccarnino as for the new window targets, you're right, but I decided a long time ago to leave that to the user. If they want a new window, they can shift+click or whatever.
@ccarnino and thanks a million for the feedback.
@ccarnino the mail links are fixed -- I had omitted the 'mailto:' portion of the link.  Also, I just noticed it, but what do you mean by BM?

I have actually given much thought to it.  There's an idea in there for sure, similar to what you said, but I'm trying to work it out so that I can go a step further, and assist startups in building effective press kits and getting them more press than they might be able to on their own.
@bmelton I love your project. It saves me a lot of time!
@bmelton For Business Model. Have you thought to be payed to send the application to all the sources you have? Sell it as service
Get in touch with me claudio at challengein.com when you've something ready that I'll help you do beta test with my startup, if it helps you ;)
Hi, I'm Boing Boing's software developer. I like seeing us up on the top there. How did you calculate our reach?

@Dino You might not like the answer, but it's basically a mashup of community-available data from places like Compete, Quantcast, Alexa, etc.  It's pretty rough at this stage, but I think it's at least representative of the real world.
@bmelton Compete has the worst data. It's way way off. Where it has data for some sites, it is likely making it up.
@bmelton Regardless, the site is good. The Effective Press Kit is the real goldmine here.
@bmelton It's really valuable to know how to approach press, and this does a decent job keeping n00bs out of the basic pitfalls.

@bmelton Not sure I can do that specifically, but I can tell you it's quite low. I suspect some of your other numbers are low as well, so changing ours would throw off the order for the list, which doesn't really help you anyway.
@bmelton A mashup is good. At least then you're getting your info from a few different sources and balancing it out a little bit. Is that number intended to be monthly visitors?

I was thinking that would be the case.  Compete has the most readily available data, which makes it heaviest in the ranking, but its numbers are low for everywhere that I can compare it to (where I know the numbers).  Quantcast data is great when it's there, but it's missing for a lot of sites period.

@bmelton You might add a little description of the kinds of startups that each site would be likely to talk about to their caption. Even linking to a few startups that the sites have posted about would be handy.
Yeah, approximated monthly visitors.  If you'd like to give me a number to let me know how far off the mark I am, I'd much appreciate it.
@bmelton thanks a lot.. website is accessible. I am sending my site http://sanetax.com/ to few sites listed.
@bmelton The startups Boing Boing would be willing to post about, and what our readers would care about, are likely quite different from TechCrunch, Mashable or YCombinator.

@Dino All very good advice.  Categories are the next obvious step, and as was suggested to me elsewhere, comments with disqus are drop-dead simple, and would be worthwhile.  Would it be possible to shoot you an email to bounce some ideas off you?
@bmelton Useful list and press kit checklist. I'd recommended that you throw google.com/adplanner/ data into calculating reach, as in most cases the reach is way off.
@bmelton Sure. dean@boingboing.net
Okay so now a submit to all with a choice of template emails :-) - but fantastic idea and bookmarked!
